bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from Dorotha Malone to Emilie Lawrence Reed, May 31, 1927

div1.p: This letter, written by a student of Edith R. Force, thanks Emilie Lawrence Reed for the life and work of Walter Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Dorotha Malone to Emilie Lawrence Reed, May 31, 1927
div1.opener:
Woodrow Wilson Jr. High
May 31, 1927 Tulsa, Okla
Mrs Walter Reed
Dear Friend,
div1.p:
My biology teacher, Miss Edith R.
Force has just been telling us
about the people who gave their
lives or part of their life in the extermination
of yellow fever. I am sure we are
in debted to you and your husband
for the help you have given in
this work. We want you to know
that we appreciate the great
work which you have done.
